Description: Rounded arsenical copper axe-head with four drilled binding-holes and two lugs. It is thickly corroded, and clearly preserved in the corrosion product is the impression of linen fabric. The line of the haft is also visible, and each of the perforations bears remains of the original binding-thong.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has indicated that after casting the blade was worked and annealed and that the cutting edge was the hardest part of the blade.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (64)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
